Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: poetsfriend
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive, Clean, and Friendly! The only complaint in our party was the beds promised were queen, but they looked a little smaller like a full size. The beds were comfortable, the price is affordable. There is construction going on all over Dallas so it is hard to navigate around, but not impossible. The rooms did not smell like smoke. The carpet was clean. The breakfast served longer hours so that was relieving. B+ Very nice stay, would definitely come back to this Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: kcrogs
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for business and really enjoyed my stay here. As other reviewers mentioned it right next to the highway and there was some construction along the highway but one day I was working in the hotel room in the early afternoon and evening, and my room was on the side of the building closest to the highway and I still did not hear anything. The building is well built and seems really sound proof. I really enjoyed the breakfast. I've stayed at other hotels that have the waffle iron and variety of cold choices, in addition to some hot choice. But I particularly enjoyed how at this Hampton the hot option was Different each morning--eggs with fresh peppers, onions, and cheese one morning, buiscuits and gravy another morning, all of it seemed freshly made and delicious. They also kept the coffee and hot water (for tea and hot chocolate) out and filled all day so I was able to have some tea later in the day--really enjoyable. Other reviewers mentioned the Happy Hour--they did not tell me it was Monday through Thursday when I checked in on a Tuesday (they just mentioned the time it started that evening). So I was pleasantly surprised by the snacks and drinks available each night. The room was excellent, bed extremely comfortable, temperature control worked great (I think I was in room 200 or something right around there), fridge and microwave nice touch, bathroom really tastefully decorated and the cleanest bathroom in any hotel I've every stayed (no mold/mildew anywhere), great work area with desk, chair, and Internet free and worked well, and I appreciate getting shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and mouthwash!! The three suggestions I have are the following: One, it would be nice if they kept a few regular plates and bowls or even paper plates and bowls so that a guest could request to use them occasionally. This is because I was in town for the entire week and had some leftover pizza in the fridge in my room, but had nothing to heat it up on in the microwave. All the hotel had was Styrofoam-type plates and bowls and things. I put the pizza on a pile of napkins (because I did not want to put Styrofoam in the microwave and get chemicals in my food). It's not a requirement but would be a nice touch to just have that available in the kitchen area if a guest asked for it. Two, the housekeeping schedule is a little strange: one of the days during the week, my meetings ended early and I got back to the hotel around 2pm, planning to work on things in my room the rest of the day. The housekeeping carts were on my floor, and when I went into my room all the towels that I had left on the floor were gone (so someone had apparently started to clean my room since they removed the dirty towels) but nothing else had been done, yet. I had a lot of work to do, so I just got to work. Some time between 4 and 4:30pm a housekeeper knocked on my door and I told her she could do whatever she needed and I would just be working at the desk. She quickly did a fantastic job cleaning but it was just awkward that they had started in my room before 2 and never actually cleaned it until hours later and were working on it so late in the day. The hotel did not seam overly crowded at all so I just did not understand why they were doing this so late in the day--since check out was at noon, why didn't they clean the rooms with people in them who were not checking out that day some time before noon and then work on the rooms that had been vacated during the afternoon? Three, be more consistent about the little things: the newspaper was left outside of rooms with people in them most mornings (There were additional copies available in the breakfast area as well), but on two of the morning I stayed there the newspaper was left in front of other people's doors but not mine. I thought that was a little strange and honestly I felt a little slighted. It's a small thing, and I did not steal the paper from in front of anyone else's room, I was just surprised. Four, I've stayed at other hotels in the area that had more dinner and other fun food options within walking distance of the hotel. I did not see any really great options on a google map of the area. Having this information more readily available for guests would be helpful. I would definitely stay here again as the staff were professional and the accommodations and breakfast fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Verry Nice”
Reviews.Author: JimDavisHouston
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. This Hampton has a Happy Hour â€“ Monday to Thursday in the front lobby. Free Food & Drinks. Itâ€™s right on the Freeway, and thereâ€™s road construction, but the room was amazingly quiet. The quietness was almost spooky. Rooms are typical Hampton. Microwave & Fridge, Thermostat controlled heat & AC that was quiet and effective. Clean carpets in the room and in the hallway. The bed was a bit softer than I like, but I got a great nights sleep every night. Flat Screen TV with 29 channels. Standard size work desk with 2 outlets on the desk lamp, and a power strip on the floor. The Free Wi-Fi was fast and reliable. No actual business center, but there were 2 computers and printer in the lobby. The fitness center has almost anything you need. The Hampton breakfasts are always great. I have yet to find a Hampton Breakfast that was sub par. Itâ€™s always more than expected. Food and convenience stores are close by.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marci B
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel clean and the rooms nice. However, the a/c was definetly a problem. I turned the thermostat down to 65 and was still sweating during the night. My husband even complained about the temperature (which is unusual for him).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect after a long day at the airport”
Reviews.Author: SLR879
Reviews.Content: After missing our flight, we had to stay at this hotel. The shuttle picked us up and the staff was very efficient at having everything ready for our stay. The rooms were very nice, quiet, and close to the vending machines and ice machine. Free wi-fi made it very convenient. The complimentary breakfast was very complete; cereal, oatmeal, muffins, fruits, and even belgian waffles made my day. If I ever have to go to Dallas, I won't hesitate on booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Neat, Quiet, and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: John30196
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 431 (the top floor) for one night on business travel. The room was very neat and clean. I had a king size bed, two end tables, a writing desk with swivel chair, a coffee table with couch. The only thing that was not it tip top shape was the couch which had about a 4" slash on the back cushion. The TV was an older model and the picture was sharp. The gym had two treadmills, a recumbent bike, a stairstepper, and a weight machine - all in good working condition. It was cold out so I didn't take time to see the pool area. They had a breakfast buffet that was well laid out. There were biscuits and gravy, scrambled eggs, bacon, assorted sweet rollls and donuts, cereals, make your own waffle, and juices. Also, prepared fruit and a basket of mixed fruite. Everything tasted fresh and the hot foods were hot and the cold foods were cold. I was impressed by the cleanliness of the hotel. Driving access was from a back street as the street the hotel fronts on is under construction. The parking lot and hotel are directly adjacent to a LaQuinta. Coming and going out the back was not a problem and there were various stores and gas stations that were extremely convenient. The WIFI was open and my iphone worked well. The staff was helpful. I liked the hotel because it appeared to be well run and maintained. Everything worked as it should and I did not have to contend with any situations that might have distracted me from my business. I booked through Orbitz and the price I received seemed a good value for the quality of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isle4Me
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hampton Inn for a seminar that we attended (not on site). The hotel was very clean and the staff friendly. Our room was spacious (and clean). The king size bed was comfortable. There was a coffe pot, refrigerator and microwave in the room, along with free wi-fi. I was able to connect to the wi-fi with my smart phone. In the morning, the hotel served a small "hot" breakfast (such as waffels, scrambled eggs, sausage, sausage gravey with biscuits, etc.), along with the usual continental breakfast items (pastries, toast, yogert, cereal, fruit). The location is right off of I-35, so "busy" outside but the traffic didn't carry inside. There are several restaurants within walking distance, and many more within driving range. The hotel suited our needs quite well. We would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night”
Reviews.Author: sspann
Reviews.Content: In areas with overwhelming heat, it was a welcomed surprise to find the room very comfortable. Very clean, evening snacks, friendly staff, very quiet room (couldn't hear freeway or raging storm that came through). Hampton Inns are our go to hotel and this was better than average. There was major road construction going on in front, but since the entrance is from the rear of the property, this was not problem. Hampton has the best bedding!

Reviews.Title: “A/C WAS TURNED DOWN OR OFF”
Reviews.Author: jamesmjrs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and the air conditioner was either off or turned down. And what kind of hotel provides fans for the rooms, i'll tell you what kind: the kind that has a broken air conditioner. Yeah the staff is nice but no air, come on. I was their with my family for a summer trip. But if i return to the dallas area, i won't be staying there. This is texas and you have to have hard working air.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abhikidiwani
Reviews.Content: Excellent Staff and service I really enjoyed my stays. breakfast is good. frontdesk is very helpful and very nice. rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Bad area-working girls”
Reviews.Author: peatrip
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hampton for many years, the staff and mgr are great, however I've never liked or felt safe at the location. I started stayiing there because my colleagues stayed there, I have to admit the happy hour and snacks are enough to be dinner, but location is horrible. I had just filled up my suburban with gas at the station across the street and when i got in the truck the next morning i realized it had been siphoned. When I got in and started the car the check engine light came on and said "fuel cap loose" .. they must have been in a hurry. Also there are always working girls on the corner and in the parking lot..(quite obivous)!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Intimate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gjohn510
Reviews.Content: This was the cleanest Hampton Inn I've stayed in. Cleaning staff is superb. There for the Superbowl, so it was centrally located. I had a great stay and happy hour is wonderful. They had a tex mex theme with wine, soda and beer to wash it down every night. Great little gym and plenty of parking. Manager is personable, which gave it that intimate feeling. Great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, bad location”
Reviews.Author: JJS_in_NB
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice but the first impression of the area was sealed when the cab pulled past the abandoned hotel that shares the parking lot. There were several homeless people "camped" out there. I did not have a rental car and the choice of restaurants in walking distance is extremely limited but the food wasn't bad. The area is also home to several Gentleman's clubs and the type of clientele that brings. I did like the happy hour and the breakfasts, they were definitely a nice touch, no complaints about the room either. Despite the area, it was a quiet hotel. I did not use the pool since it seemed too "exposed" outside beside the highway and with the bums around.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, but not Amazing”
Reviews.Author: kevink76801
Reviews.Content: My wife, myself, and a friend recently stayed at the Hampton in North Dallas. Although the hotel wasn't bad, it wasn't great. Cons: The furnishings seemed outdated to me, the lighting was also not very good. The pool was not open. Although it is an outdoor pool and it was in the fall, I still thought it would be open. The biggest thing was I didn't care for the decorations, etc... It was not on part with many of the other Hamptons I have stayed at. The tv programming was also annoying because it kept switching to the programming channel when you were watching it. Also, it is next to a night club and I believe I could hear some of the music from the night club at night. It wasn't too bad and didn't cause me to lose any sleep, but still another factor. Pros: The breakfast was good and the bathroom was nice. The staff was also very pleasant. Check-in was also very easy. It isn't a bad hotel, but just not an amazing stay. I wouldn't stay there again, but that is just my tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Tut visit-I was VERY impressed with the staff's friendliness & helpfulness.”
Reviews.Author: Grandma001
Reviews.Content: The lady behind the desk at check-in was extremely helpful in getting our King Tut tickets. We needed them all on Friday since we were going with children & couldn't get everyone together on Saturday. Also, the manager that evening went out and skimmed the leaves from the pool so the children could try to go swimming. (They were so looking forward to swimming.) He was right that it was too cold, but the kids appreciated being able to get wet a couple of times before they started to turn blue & we got them out. Also the air conditioning went on the fritz Saturday night & the staff gave us vouchers for another night. We hope to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel-Loved the King Tut package”
Reviews.Author: Janet79720
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here on 3-12-09 as part of the King Tut Package. The price was wonderful ($115 including tax and that's including the 2 VIP tickets), as I would have had to pay about $50 for the King Tut tickets alone (and then they would have had to be for a specific date/time--the VIP is for any day/any time). The rooms were very clean and nice. I did not use the business center or the in-room internet service. In addition to pay-per view movies, the had pay-per play video games! The beds were very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The morning breakfast offered hot food and fresh fruit in addition to the typical pastries and cereal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: abiTexas
Reviews.Content: Our recent hotel stay at the Hampton Inn Dallas North was very pleasant. The room was clean and the staff was very friendly. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's the Hampton, what do you want?”
Reviews.Author: Hamptonman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 4 times in 2007. Each stay was a week so I know this hotel well. The best part of this hotel is itâ€™s proximity to the freeway. You can get all over the Metroplex quickly and easily. The neighborhood is not for everyone so if you are looking for the trendy Dallas you will need to stay away from this hotel. But the rooms are cheap, clean, and there is a happy hour. There is nothing happy about it because the lobby is filled with mid-level sales people talking [-] and eating Velveeta covered steal tortilla chips. But the beer, the free beer is ice cold, plentiful, and you can snag a few for your room. Grab a few ice cold beers and some Texas style bar-be-que turn on SportsCenter and you might just forget how bad your life sucks. Gods Speed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: jetsetterwannabe
Reviews.Content: Great place for stay to hit the Northwest Highway @ 35E area or Composite Drive area of Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable hotel, rough neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Hello_Godspeed
Reviews.Content: Caution booking this location, the neighborhood is rather dirty and in my opinion not very safe. This location is right next door to a huge night club (250+ seat capacity), if you room is on that end of the building you may have a problem with noise. The Hampton Walnut Hill is clean and recently renovated and the staff was professional. I did not say they were polite, but they were capable. But over the course of my four night stay they kept the room clean and were responsive to my requests. All rooms have the Hampton bed, a real plus for the $70 a night price. Furnishings were new and the room was in good repair. The complementary breakfast was typical for a Hampton Inn, go with the brown bag to go it was more satisfying and fresher. Lobby is recently redecorated though low ceilings make it feel cramped, not a place to hang out for any time. Each evening they host happy hour from 5 - 7 PM. There were a couple of warm catered items, domestic beer and box win available. Other than a very dingy national chain breakfast restaurant in the parking lot there are no other dining options within two miles. Although, if you proceed south two exits on 35E you will find all of the common chain restaurants (Red Lobster, Papadeaux, steak houses, fast food, etc.) in one central area. As this is Dallas there are many fine restaurants within 20 minutes drive. For this area the price was reasonable, the accommodations were better than expected but the location is a bit scary after the sun sets.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Here Many Times”
Reviews.Author: taprennoc
Reviews.Content: I travel about 40 weeks a year, and try to stay at Hilton Family Hotels, mainly Hamptons, as much as possible, being a diamond member with them. I have stayed at this particular Hampton Inn many times over the past several years, and I will say it is up to par with most Hamptons I frequent. The recent remodel in the lobby and the new carpet thru out was needed, but is a nice and inviting. The new Hampton Bed linens are as good as a more expensive hotel, and the staff at this particular Hampton are extremely pleasant. They have a nice happy hour in the afternoons with free hot snakcs, beer, wine, and sodas which a lot of Hamptons do not do. The price here is very reasonable, and if your AAA you get 10% off when booking on their site. My only complaint would be the surrounding area, called "restaurant row" but it is a little seedy. Still some good restaurants for every taste very close to the hotel. I always book this hotel when in Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amwtcorley
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be clean, comfortable and the staff to be friendly and knowledgable. It was a nice experience but not above normal. The hotel would be good for just about any reason for being in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Quality, just as expected.”
Reviews.Author: Jaragono
Reviews.Content: As every Hampton Inn I have been in, this is a good option, the neighborhood is not very upscale, so the hotel isn't the best one (my best Hampton Inn experience has been Houston Galleria). Clean rooms, excellent service, good breakfast options (considering it is complimentary), even when they say it has been recently renewed, my room had some worn out signals in the bath room and the beds were jumpy. As it is on I-35E is very well located.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Dallas North / I-35 East At Walnut Hill
HotelInfo.Address: 11069 Composite Drive, Dallas, TX 75229
